item.title: A Birch Tree in Winter
item.description: The result of an attempt at watercolors.

item.title: Last Day with Diesel
item.description: I wrote this after the death of our beloved Great Dane named Diesel. Last Day with Diesel free of collar and of leash he paused to keep the pace, we watched with apprehension fearing pain upon his face he stood and looked around him that gray and misty day, in a field, his domain, that had just been cleared of hay he paused for a moment, while the breeze brought him a smell,

item.title: Off Past Canaan
item.description: I wrote this for my grandmother’s memorial service. Both of my grandparents enjoyed snowmobiling from the late 60’s until their passing. The above photo and many childhood memories were inspiration for this poem. Off Past Canaan The clock chimed high from the southern wall, signaling the end of the dinner call. The television is off, the suit is found, the wood stove is stuffed so it won’t go out.
